intro: Trachoma gamma, commonly known as the "false dandelion," is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a hairy surface. Trachoma gamma is native to regions of southern Africa and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
